title: Cincinnati Chili Spaghetti
directions: Heat the oil in large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat and add beef, onions and garlic. Season with salt and pepper and break the meat apart as it cooks.
Add the chili powder, cayenne, cumin, cinnamon and allspice. Cook 2 to 3 more minutes, stirring often.
Stir in the crushed tomatoes, water, the bay leaf, cocoa powder, Worcestershire sauce and vinegar. Season with more salt and black pepper.
Bring to a simmer and cook 1 hour, stirring and tasting often - season as needed.
Cook the spaghetti to al dente according to package directions in plenty of salted water. Heat the beans.
Remove the bay leaf and discard. Serve the chili over spaghetti garnished with your choice of kidney beans, raw onion, cheese and crushed oyster crackers.
ingredients: coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons sherry or red wine vinegar
2 - 3 cups finely shredded extra sharp cheddar cheese
